item.title: How to Write a Golang App Remotely on a Raspberry Pi Using Atom
item.description:
Photo by Harrison Broadbent on Unsplash. Wouldn’t it be cool to remotely program a Golang app on a Raspberry Pi? In this post, I write how to do that if you are using Atom. TL;DR;
Setup a Raspberry Pi Device Setup Golang on that Device Install remote-ftp on your Machine Connect from your Atom Write a Golang Application

item.title: Monorepos done right
item.description: There’s a lot of arguments for and against monorepos. Done right, I believe monorepos will help you move with urgency and focus as your engineering organization grows. That doesn’t mean it’s easy! I’ve also seen monorepos turn into monoliths that block teams from getting anything out in a timely manner.

item.title: Good-case Latency of Rotating Leader Synchronous BFT
item.description: Synchronous consensus protocols can tolerate $f &lt; n/2$ Byzantine failures but for $n/3 &lt;f &lt;n/2$ must depend on the maximum network delay $\Delta$ for their safety and progress. So these protocols must set $\Delta$ to be much larger than the actual network delay $\delta \ll \Delta$. The good news is...
